title: Clophill and Haynes Circular Walk Route

images.title: Rodney Burton / Clophill village green and High St, Beds
images.caption: Clophill village green and High St, Beds. View towards the A6 with the Flying Horse pub on the corner.

images.title: Mr Biz, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: St Mary's Old Ruined Church, Clophill. Redundant since 1972, the church stands on a lonely hilltop north of the village; it has a rich history of myths and legends.

images.title: Rodney Burton / Longhorns taking a rest beside the Greensand Ridge Walk, Clophill, Beds
images.caption: Longhorns taking a rest beside the Greensand Ridge Walk, Clophill, Beds

images.title: Robin Drayton / House and Victorian water pump, Haynes Church End
images.caption: House and Victorian water pump, Haynes Church End. A cast iron pump erected in 1867. The box cover above the spout bears the inscription 'O YE WELLS BLESS YE THE LORD'.

images.title: Robin Drayton / Pilgrim Cottage, Northwood End Road
images.caption: Pilgrim Cottage, Northwood End Road. Pilgrims rested here before their final destination, Chicksands Priory. John Bunyan is also reputed to have preached here.

images.title: John Yaxley / Along Greensands Ridge Walk
images.caption: Along Greensands Ridge Walk

images.title: Richard Thomas / Green Man Public House
images.caption: Green Man Public House

images.title: Rodney Burton / Farmland west of Great Lane, Clophill, Beds
images.caption: Farmland west of Great Lane, Clophill, Beds

description: A circular walk visiting the settlements of Clophill and Haynes in Bedfordshire. The route runs for about 7 miles with a few small climbs, some woodland stretches and a visit to an ancient church on the way. The walk starts in Clophill where you can pick up the Greensand Ridge Walk and follow the waymarked trail north east to Pedley Wood and Chicksands Wood . There's some peaceful woodland trails here which will take you up to Appley Corner before reaching the village of Haynes. From Haynes you the follow public footpaths south west to Sandpit Farm before passing Northfield College and returining to Clophill. You can extend the walk by heading north west from the village to visit the nearby Maulden Woods .
